title: Sight Word Instructional Design for Students with Developmental Disabilities: Comparing Immediate vs. Delayed Error Correction

context.prior_knowledge: Proficiency in basic mathematical terminology and reading comprehension
context.additional_context: Design of a customized sight word education program for students with developmental disabilities. Parallel use of digital/analog materials in a BYOD environment. Focuses on acquiring mathematical terminology for pre-professional learners

learning_goals: Learners can master mathematical sight words (e.g., integral, equation) with 80% accuracy via immediate error correction over three consecutive attempts
Learners demonstrate a 20% improvement in word recognition speed with immediate error correction compared to delayed error correction
